attributes.action: grant automatic residency to Gurkhas that retired prior to 1997, and pay them pensions equal to that of British service personnel
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Gurkhas have fought for the British government for 200 years. They gave their lives for this country and in return they are ignored when they retire.

Amazingly, those soldiers that retired before 1997 do not even receive automatic residency or pension. Those that retired after 1997 get around a third of the pension given to British service personnel.

Is this the way to thank people who risked their lives for our country?
